availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Hugh Irvine (Louisville, Kentucky, farmer, merchant, councilman, and state representative)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, farmer, lumber merchant, councilman, and state representative. Pennsylvania native. Married to Anne Caruthers Irvine. Father of Elizabeth Irvine, William Irvine, Mary Irvine, Nancy J. Irvine, James Irvine, and John B. Irvine. Farmer in Westmoreland County, Pennsylvania, in 1850. Lumber merchant in Louisville, Kentucky, in 1860. Lumber merchant in Louisville in 1861. Merchant in Lousiville in 1863. Councilman for the First Ward of the Louisville City Council from 1861 to 1863. Delegate to the Congressional Convention for the Fifth Congressional District of Kentucky in 1863. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from the City of Louisville from 1863 to 1864.
